SEARCH
Package com.csse3200.game.areas

Class LevelGameArea

java.lang.Object
com.csse3200.game.areas.GameArea
com.csse3200.game.areas.LevelGameArea
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable, AreaAPI, EnemySpawner
Direct Known Subclasses:
SlotMachineArea
public class LevelGameArea extends GameArea implements AreaAPI, EnemySpawner
Creates a level in the game, creates the map, a tiled grid for the playing area and a player unit inventory allowing the player to add units to the grid.

  • Field Summary

    • markNextPlacementFree

      public void markNextPlacementFree()

    • spawnRobotOnDefence

      public void spawnRobotOnDefence(RobotFactory.RobotType robotType)
      Spawns a robot directly on top of an existing defence (placed unit) on the grid. If no defence exists, does nothing and logs a warning.

    • spawnProjectile

      public void spawnProjectile(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 spawnPos, Entity projectile, TargetDetectionTasks.AttackDirection direction, int damage)
      Spawns a projectile entity at a given position and initiates its behaviour, depending on the type of projectile (identified by the ProjectileTagComponent.
      Parameters:
      spawnPos - the coordinates the projectile should spawn at
      projectile - the projectile entity to spawn
      direction - the direction the projectile moves in, left or right

    • spawnRobotProjectile

      Parameters:

    • damageRobotsAtPosition

      public void damageRobotsAtPosition(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 landingPos, float radius, int damage)
      Deal damage to all robots in a circular area around the given world position.
      Parameters:
      landingPos - The world coordinates where the projectile landed
      radius - Radius of effect in world units (e.g., 1 tile = tileSize)
      damage - Amount of damage to apply

    • createWavePreview

      public void createWavePreview()
      Create symbolic entities to preview the upcoming wave. Positions a couple of placeholder robots per row just off the right edge. These are visual only and removed after the intro camera pan.

    • clearWavePreview

      public void clearWavePreview()
      Remove preview entities created for the intro camera pan.
